A Sustainable Arts Sector

Jan 14, 2008

What looks like an interesting paper from across the pond, via theatre notes.:

It's well worth threading through the complexities of the argument: it may sometimes be a little dry, but it's packed with useful background, and is an illuminating survey of government arts policy, both here and in the UK. At base, this is a passionate advocacy of the place of the arts in contemporary society, and an intelligent argument for a more holistic and multi-dimensional approach to arts funding. (We're talking private as well as public investment). In particular, arguing that we should attempt to think more long-term about our arts ecology

"Arts Ecology." I think that this is a term with an underlying truth to it. I'll have to pony up for the paper at some point when it has a higher degree of relevance in my studies.
